intro: Sturmia coelogynoides, commonly known as the yellow sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has opposite, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Sturmia coelogynoides is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
